intro: Oosterdyckia, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellow flowers and is native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. The plants typically have basal leaves that are lobed or toothed, and they often grow in grassy areas or disturbed soils. Oosterdyckia species are often found in open habitats such as meadows and roadside verges. They are relatively short-lived and may bloom in the first year of growth.
